Understate: The claim understates the fact that Republicans had control of both the White House and Congress during the George W. Bush presidency from 2001 to 2009.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not acknowledging that Republicans had control of the House and Senate during the George W. Bush presidency.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that 1928 was the last time Republicans had control of the White House, the House, and the Senate.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as it fails to consider the Republican control of the White House, the House, and the Senate during the George W. Bush presidency.
